title.narrative: CSR-facility. IBIS. Tax and CSR - Dialogue about principles for responsible tax in developing countries

description.narrative: The overall objective of the project is to increase tax revenues in developing countries. A more responsible approach to taxes by companies, investors and development funds will potentially increase developing countries' internal resource mobilization significantly and, thus strengthening an inclusive growth in developing countries with huge impact on poverty reduction. It is a specific objective to establish tax as part of the agenda for social responsibility. This will be done by; mapping firms and investors management of responsible tax in developing countries, strengthen dialogue and debate among key actors, develop a common understanding and principles for responsible tax, and by piloting principles, tools and best practices for responsible tax for companies and investors. It is a specific objective to establish dialogue and develop principles for Danish and international development funds (IFU, IFC, EIB, AfDB, IDB) on how responsible tax can be incorporated into the development funds criteria for the selection and evaluation of projects in developing countries. the grant is for a three year period from 2014 to 2016.
